kids.q:
Benayahu the son of Yehouada
This is a reference to the Sanhedrin.
And Evyathar
This is a reference to the Urim VeTumim
As Scripture says elsewhere:
And Benayahu the son of Yehoyada
was above the Kereisi and the Peleisi
This means that the Sanhedrin took
immediate precedence to the Urim VeTumim.

Question: Why were the Urim VeTumim
       called Kereisi and Peleisi?
  Answer:   They were called Kereisi because
       they rendered their words precisely,
       They were called Peleisi because
       they were wondrous in their words.

David: Go and support each other.
Sages: A handful of food does not satisfy a lion,
and a pit cannot be filled from its own Earth!

When the light of dawn rose, the sages of
Israel entered into King David"s presence.
Sages: Our Master, the king!
Your nation Israel needs sustence.

Elijah And not only this, but at the time that the people of Israel
enter the synagogues and house of study
and respond in the Kaddish,
MAY THE GREAT NAME BE BLESSED,
God shakes his head and says,
"Fortunate is the the king
who is praised this way in his house.
What is there for the father who has exiled his sons?
And woe to the sons who have been exiled form their fathers table."

Elijah: What sound did you hear when you were in this ruin?
Yose: I heard a heavenly voice that was cooing like a dove,
saying: "Woe to the sons because of whose sins
I destroyed my house, and burned my temple,
and exiled them among the nations of the world."
Elijah: By your life and the life of your head, it is not only
at this moment that the heavenly voice says this,
But on each and every day it says this 3 times,

kids.t: Why Did You Enter the Ruin?
kids.q:
Elijah: Peace be unto you my teacher
Yose: Peace unto you my teacher and master.
Elijah: My son, for what reason did you
enter this ruin and endanger yourself?
Yose: To Pray.
Elijah: You should have prayed on the road
and have not entered the ruin.
Yose: I did not pray on the road for I was afraid
that a passerby might interrupt me.
Elijah: In that case you should have
prayed the abridged prayer.

Yose relates a personal story
about his meeting with Elijah.
I was once travelling on the road,
and I entered a ruin of Jerusalem to pray.
Elijah the prophet, remembered for the good,
came and waited for me at the entrance
of the ruin until I finished my prayer.

The night consists of 3 watches, and at each
and every watch God sits and roars like a lion,
God Woe to the children that because of their sins
I destroyed My Temple, burned My Sancutary,
and exiled them among the nations of the world.

The night consists of 3 watches.
By speaking of watches rather
than hours it teaches that
there are watches in Heaven and
there are watches on Earth
that are paired up together.
So when it is night on Earth
the span of the night can be
broken up into 3 distinct parts.
At each of these parts of the night,
when God screams in Heaven
something on Earth is also screaming.

rabbi.T: Anyone Heard Anything Make It Known
Divide A Third For Worker To Take
Left None Stole All, Not Rightful Share
Huna Harbored Claim, Cannot Withhold From Worker
Price Of Vinegar To Price Of Wine

academic.q:
The night consists of 3 watches.
By speaking of watches rather
than hours it teaches that
there are watches in Heaven and
there are watches on Earth
that are paired up together.

So when it is night on Earth
the span of the night can be
broken up into 3 distinct parts.
At each of these parts of the night,
when God screams in Heaven
something on Earth is also screaming.

The night consists of 3 watches, and at each
and every watch God sits and roars like a lion,
crying out over the suffering of Israel
and the loss of connection with His people.

God screams throughout the night:
God Woe to the children that because of their sins
I destroyed My Temple, burned My Sancutary,
and exiled them among the nations of the world.

pieces.q:
Now the next year he again went and spent the night in the cemetary,
And he heard the same two spirits conversing with each other:
Spirit 1 My friend, let us roam the world and hear
from behind the curtain what misfortune
is to come to the world this year.
Spirit 2 My friend, Leave me be!
The words that we have spoke between
ourselves in year past have already
been heard among the living.
 Question:  So perhaps the dead do know what is spoken by the living,
      since this spirit was aware of what her mother had been told?
 Answer:   Perhaps another person died in the meantime
      and went and told them about it.
